definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: The small text that follows recounts with humor one of the enormities of modernization.
sentences.chinese: 小文本如下叙述与幽默现代化的滔天大罪之一。

sentences.english: B: I would feel that I am the only one to pull everybody's leg.
sentences.chinese: 作恶多端，总是有意或无意地犯下一些“滔天大罪”。

sentences.english: The cruel criminal committed towering crimes these days.
sentences.chinese: 那个凶恶的罪犯这些日子犯了滔天大罪。

sentences.english: A simple mistake in judgement was often magnified to the proportions of a major crime.
sentences.chinese: 在审判时，小的过失常常被夸大到滔天大罪。

definition: death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
so many that the bamboo slats have been exhausted/innumerable crimes (idiom)/see also 罄筆難書|罄笔难书[qing4 bi3 nan2 shu1]
guilty and deserves to be punished (idiom); entirely appropriate chastisement/the punishment fits the crime
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
debts of blood crying out for retribution
